issues.description: Return-type mismatch for messageOnMilk(): The UML in the problem statement (and the textual task description) specifies Milkable.messageOnMilk() should return a boolean (true if milking was successful, false otherwise). The solution repository instead declares Milkable.messageOnMilk() returning String and implements Goat and Seal.messageOnMilk() to return descriptive Strings (e.g. "Goat <name> is milked"). This contradicts the specification and would confuse students (and break tests) expecting a boolean return.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Milkable API consistent with the problem statement. Either (A) change the solution to match the spec: update Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return boolean and modify Goat and Seal to return true/false (e.g. return true to indicate successful milking), or (B) if the intended design is to return a String message, update the problem statement and UML to specify a String return type and adjust the textual description/tests accordingly. Option A is recommended because the problem text explicitly describes messageOnMilk() as boolean.
